intro: Monopyle ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian monopyle, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem and are covered in a fine layer of hairs. Monopyle ecuadorensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
